content:
It's great to hear that you're already experimenting with new ingredients and recipes in your cooking classes! Using meal planning tools can definitely help you stay organized, reduce food waste, and make the most of the ingredients you have at home.

Based on your interests and cooking habits, I think **Yummly** or **Mealime** might be a good fit for you. Both apps are user-friendly, have a large recipe database, and allow you to input the ingredients you have at home to suggest recipes. They also have meal planning features, generate grocery lists, and provide nutritional information.

**Yummly** is particularly useful if you're looking for a wide variety of recipes and cooking inspiration. It has a large community of users who share and save recipes, and you can discover new recipes based on your dietary preferences and ingredient availability.

**Mealime**, on the other hand, is great for planning meals around the ingredients you have at home. It has a simple and intuitive interface, and it's easy to add and remove ingredients from your pantry. It also provides a meal planning calendar, which can help you plan your meals for the week.

**BigOven** is another great option, especially if you're looking for a large recipe database and a user-friendly interface. It has a huge collection of recipes, and you can filter them based on ingredients, cooking time, and dietary preferences.

Ultimately, the best app or website for you will depend on your personal preferences and cooking style. You might want to try out a few different options to see which one works best for you.

Do you have any specific features or functionalities that you're looking for in a meal planning tool?
